body.p:
Covington Ky April 5th 1865
Gov. Bramlitte
Dear Sir

I may perhaps be a stranger to you, apparently but I have often seen you but in humble positions still you may recollect me. I am Engaged in the practice of Law here and have been for the last 12 years having served as presiding Judge and Clerk of the Kenton County Court. In my practice I find it frequently inconvienent to have affadavits taken and particularly at this time in fixing up papers that go before the provost Marshall &c
Therefore I would be pleased and accomodated to have you send me a commission as Notary Publick for Kenton County and in so doing you will oblige

N B. Lafayette Brafford sent a Petition to be relieved of a fine of one hundred dollars assessed against him at the March Term of Our Kenton Circuit Court 1865 will you please see his Petition I think you would do him an act of Justice in remitting so far as you can his fine please direct to me

Yours
S. C. Perrin
Kenton Co
Notary Public
S. C. SpPerrin
apptd
6th Mch 1865
